The '''JavaScript version''' of ''[[Minecraft 4k]]'' was released on December 2, 2012, three years after the last version of 4k ([[4k-2]]). Unlike other versions, its code is openly accessible and easily editable.
It is the last known version of ''Minecraft 4k'' to be released.

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Water block 4K.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Water|Water]]{{Conjecture|tag=1|nocat=1}}'''
*Replaced [[Minecraft 4k/Dirt|Dirt]] with a block ID of 9.

== Changes ==
=== World generation ===
* The world is now generated in a tunnel shape which the camera endlessly moves through.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Controls]]'''
* The player can no longer place blocks, break blocks, or move.
* The camera now rotates automatically in a continuous circular motion.

== Removals ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Dirt 9 4K2.png|32px]] [[Minecraft 4k/Dirt#9|Dirt]] with block ID 9'''
* Replaced by water.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Controls]]'''
* The ability to place or break blocks has been completely removed.
* The player can no longer move around the world or turn the camera freely.
